results.title: Rural industries
results.creator_credit: John Leake, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia in the 80’s”.
Australia’s modern techniques of cultivation and harvesting are demonstrated to show how this country is a major supplier of grain to the world. The film also shows how the cattle and livestock industry supply food to most parts of the globe.

results.title: Earthly beings
results.creator_credit: Chuck Eyler, Jacolyn Kildare and Heaping Teaspoon Animation
results.brief_description: An animated film depicting nature and the way it feeds upon itself. Ink and paint illustrations are from the works of anatomist, Andreas Vesalius of Brussels 1514-1564, Music is composed and conducted by Katherine Alisa Arnold

results.title: Mexico: a family style menu
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Joaquin Guzman has been a chef for over twenty-five years. He takes immense pride in his craft, his position and his country’s long history.

results.title: A New Deal?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rich World Poor World”.
About 10000 people around the world die every day from lack of food. Are we really heading for global disaster? What can the world do to help itself? This and other questions about world poverty are discussed

results.title: Exploring, investigating, learning (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Presents sequences of children playing in a kindergarten program and explains the role teachers may take. It is about exploring, about young children’s investigating behaviour and ways of helping children to take an active role in their own development.

results.title: Tomorrow's child
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: With step by step precision and sympathetic understanding this film shows the fascinating story behind the latest amazing advances in ‘test-tube baby’ or more accurately, In Vitro Fertilisation techniques, with human embryo transfer by the Monash University Medical Team at the Queen Victoria Medical Centre.

results.title: The Tap dance kid
results.creator_credit: Barra Grant, Evelyn Barron and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Eight year old Willie Sheridan has a single passion - dancing. His twelve-year-old sister Emma wants to be a lawyer. When Willie, with Emma’s help, gets a chance to audition for summer stock, the entire family confronts the conflict between parents wishes and children’s dreams.
Based on the book “Nobody’s family is going to change” by Louise Fitzhugh.

results.title: Doodle film
results.creator_credit: Donald Winkler, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The dossier of an inveterate doodler, a man whose compulsion to put scrawls and squiggles on everything at hand brings him to no good end, according to the narrator, at least. The commentary, delivered with the perspicacity of a coroner’s report, follows the development of the doodler’s mania from boyhood through adolescence to manhood, when it suddenly breaks all bounds. An amusing “case history” that some of us might identify with. Voice and narration provided by Maurice Podbrey. (Awards: Atlanta; Chicago)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Winkler, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Disappearing trick
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from the book ” A Bear called Paddington”. Paddington puts on a magic show for the Brown Family, Mr. Gruber and Mr. Curry. After repeatedly annoying Mr. Curry in the course of his demonstration of magic tricks, Paddington decides it is time to disappear.
